intro: Trapella sinensis var. antennifera, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions and thrives in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
